title: So what kind of support do people find healthy?
body:
So far I have heard:

{{champion:40}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:16}} - Braindead boosted players just spam shield/heal 
{{champion:412}} {{champion:223}} - Too hard to catch adc out with lanturn/tahm w instantly saving them
{{champion:53}} {{champion:25}}  - All they do is land 1 skillshot and then give adc free kills even if the adc is bad
{{champion:63}} - Does too much damage as a support

So then what supports DOES boards find healthy, or does boards just hate all supports in this game.

replies.body: Taric

> [{quoted}](name=Verxint,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2018-04-09T17:11:39.336+0000)
>
> Taric

His ult is actually pretty frustrating to play against, but other than that, I think Taric is fine

{{champion:432}} {{champion:26}} {{champion:267}} 

You have to be good at the champ and have supporting knowledge, can dish out reasonable amounts of damage and utility depending on builds, and even if you're good, you still have weaknesses that the enemy can find ways to play around.
I highly disagree with Zilean. That champion is and always will be cancer. A better 3rd pick would be Taric or Rakan, I do not have a problem with either of them.

Rakan is anything but healthy. He's the Lee Sin of supports in that whoever designed him was like "let's see how many things we can cram into a single champion's kit and get away with it". {{champion:201}} is much more deserving of being counted amongst well-designed heroes. Relatively simple kit which manages to fulfill character fantasy with clear strenghts and weaknesses.

Rakan my seem that way until you consider that fact that he is a support. All the mobility in the world is not going to save an adc like a lulu shield/ult will. Rakan doesn’t have powerful or consistent (lulu’s shield can be up permanently at 45% cdr, Rakan’s is far from that) defensive spells so he makes up for by trying to draw agro to himself then fall back.
Edit: Some honorable mention weaknesses: His mobility is usually limited to his proximity to an ally, his ult provides no CC immunity (point-click wither him if you want), he is squishy yet has to dive to be effective, and his shield places him right next to allies so aoe can destroy him.

Bad Jannas will still win because she has a functioning E and W buttons, "bad" Thresh players can still win because he landed a lucky hook and pulled a basic combo and that can be the only thing he knows how to do well, and so on. A bad Zilean will fuck over his team, if he only knows how to land bombs or use his ult. Good ones are cancer, I agree with you on that. 

Even the best ones are still exploitable, in the sense that you can still do something against him. You still got breathing room and don't feel "outclassed by champ select" because sustain is something he doesn't have, for example.

Bards damage is insanely high, coupled with really low stun cd and one of the best game breaking ults.  No way in hell i would list him as "healthy".
Nami buffs her adc with a free frozen mallet and wits end combo.  Sure she is healthier but not quite there yet.
Zilean is a snowball pick, so he has all the problems and unhealthiness that comes with that.

my vote would be {{champion:201}} he is alittle over tuned but he fits the "support" role really well.  Stun thats you can see coming and avoid, a slow that has short cd but doesnt have 100% uptime, Ult peel that can miss and is only really effective verse 1 target and protection that is not "adc only" synergistic.  The protection (braum shield) is also a type of skill shot with decent cooldown and isnt a generic heal/shield.  

You can always out play braum and you can out play others as braum.  His peel and protection is also more focused instead of generically good always.

bard - there's a wall 20 feet away in behind you and to one side? Throw q at enemy in front of you and watch it do a 150 degree turn to stun someone. Yep, lot's of skill there. I mean, there are skills involved like magical journey, good ults, shrine usage. But his q is kinda broken easy to stun with and should be fixed. I don't mind a 30 degree turn or something  but when it's literally turning over 90 degrees to hit a 2nd target and stun? That's just stupid.

Zilean is oppressive at certain stages of the game and especially against certain comps, but overall is pretty reasonable due to power troughs as well as moments of being sheer op.

Nami - 100% agree with you; skills get rewarded. No stat disgustingly overtuned on her. Good mix of cc and sustain, but not overbearing in any one point nor stupidly spammable.

Can't say I've experienced that more than a few times as a Bard main. Nearly every Q landed has to be intentionally angled to hit about a 40-45* arc behind the target. If I'm going to call BS on anything it's the hitbox detection of Blitzcrank's hook.

I've been called oppressive a few times recently on Zil actually, but I did take a build that was fun for me, annoying for the enemy...

Also got kinda fed in those actually {{sticker:sg-poppy}}
Zil is same as Morganana to me

> [{quoted}](name=Cancerous Lulu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2018-04-09T19:10:33.820+0000)

Sorry you gotta time it because using it too soon will render your ult useless.

While some others if you use your ult too soon, you'd still get away.

> [{quoted}](name=Cancerous Lulu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=000b00040000,timestamp=2018-04-21T04:09:21.125+0000)
>
> Sorry you gotta time it because using it too soon will render your ult useless.

ignoring how it isn't that hard to time, especially in_ league of damagez_, using it too soon is effectively making your ADC invincible for 5 seconds since everyone will hold off on killing them.

Thats hella powerful in of itself.
Did i mention he has a point and Click 2.5 second 99% slow? 
shit is over 3 times more potent than {{summoner:3}}.

> While some others if you use your ult too soon, you'd still get away.

...you mean mean like Zilean?

A lot of players consider ADC overpowered and don't think it should have a dedicated defender. 

That's why when you play support you hear stuff like-
'Oh, OF COURSE Lulu polymorphs me when I go in! EVERY TIME.'
Um... no way, _really_? Holy moly, I thought my character was just a CUTE DECORATION that followed the ADC around.

I literally haven't played a sup that people don't flame over. Even Thresh and Bard get the schtick.

A lot of assassins and divers believe they deserve to win 1v2s if one of the 2 is a support.  Because everyone knows those aren't supposed to be real champions, so you just 1v1 the enemy champion and then clean up the funny-looking minion afterward.

It doesn't help that the game actually played like that for multiple seasons.

> [{quoted}](name=Partholonian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=00150000,timestamp=2018-04-10T02:17:01.987+0000)
>

> 
> It doesn't help that the game actually played like that for multiple seasons.

This.
100%

people are just butthurt that supports aren't as easy of a target anymore. they want ward bots to be walking around for free gold. Now that support bard turns around and makes you taste the power of meep! {{sticker:sg-syndra}}

Yeah, I think this is pretty much it.  Boards are full of assassin mains (including Yi and other jungle assassins along with lane assassins) and the only kind of support they like is the one they can kill 10 times in the first 10 minutes so they get fed enough to "outplay" everyone else too.

80% of players in the 4.5 v 4.5 era used to agree it felt good to have that half champion to push around even if you fell behind the other real champions.  So they can't understand why Riot would ruin something like that.

> [{quoted}](name=Partholonian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2018-04-10T02:12:44.607+0000)

> 
> 80% of players in the 4.5 v 4.5 era used to agree it felt good to have that half champion to push around even if you fell behind the other real champions.  So they can't understand why Riot would ruin something like that.

As someone who plays both Support AND assassin, this is pretty much correct.

except bard  does carry levels of damage.  You think you are catching out bard but he is actually just baiting you.  You jump on him and he just stuns, ignites, and auto attacks for more damage then you and you die.  Or he just goes through the wall and escapes.   Or he ults you in place and his team shows up.

Buff bards heal and nerf his damage then maybe he will be a support and not APC.

> [{quoted}](name=Skeletons Grave,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=00100002,timestamp=2018-04-10T17:56:57.908+0000)

You jump on him and he just stuns, ignites, and auto attacks for more damage then you and you die.  Or he just goes through the wall and escapes.   Or he ults you in place and his team shows up.
> 
> Buff bards heal and nerf his damage then maybe he will be a support and not APC.

More like buff his armor/mr, nerf his damage.

"So then what supports DOES boards find healthy, or does boards just hate all supports in this game."

I feel that a lot of ppl just wants Supps to be ward dispensers without game agency. I mean, if they hate enchanter supps, tank supps and mages supps maybe it's just that they hate supps as a role.

> [{quoted}](name=saltran,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2018-04-09T19:05:54.171+0000)
>
> "So then what supports DOES boards find healthy, or does boards just hate all supports in this game."
> 
> I feel that a lot of ppl just wants Supps to be ward dispensers without game agency. I mean, if they hate enchanter supps, tank supps and mages supps maybe it's just that they hate supps as a role.

It's because Riot is adamant on never ever nerfing ADC. So the best thing you can do in order to nerf them indirectly is to nerf their sla... supports.

Everything is balanced around ADC being the kings.

Bard I think is a consistently popular support, including for players playing against him. He gives plenty of opportunities to both his allies and opponents, and has a kit that isn't too overly focused on saving allies or stun-locking enemies, so he doesn't feel excessively frustrating even when he's played well.

Nami is another support who's generally well-liked by the Boards. She feels fair to play against, but also satisfying to play, and has a diverse array of tools that, again, lets her assist allies and disable enemies, but without ever shutting someone down completely at the press of a button.

By contrast, the major problem with many of the supports mentioned in the OP is that they frequently have this one button they press that can instantly shut down much more skillful plays. Enchanters typically have this problem due to an excessive portion of their power budget being placed onto on-demand shielding or healing, and particular champions like Lulu, Morgana, Thresh, Blitz, etc. are also notorious for having one CC ability that can easily stop certain champions from playing the game entirely. Mage supports tend to frustrate ADC players because their high bases and relative independence from scalings means they can easily deal a lot of damage in a squishy lane, which feels cheap, and it's especially irritating when these same mages also have damage that is relatively easy to apply, as has been the case for Brand and Malzahar in the past.

I enjoy fighting against and respect good Rakan and Nami players

Respect to god Thresh players too.

excuse me?

thresh lantern can be blocked, and if the dude is cc'ed he can't take it
{{champion:89}}

> [{quoted}](name=Seen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-04-09T16:47:01.609+0000)

Ever since they updated her lore, would not bump.

If I wanted to praise the sun, I'd just go play dark souls instead.

> [{quoted}](name=Seen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-04-09T16:47:01.609+0000)
>
> {{champion:89}}

"braindead tank just strictly press 3 buttons in a row and abuse hitbox and do absolutely nothing else"
Clear strengths and weaknesses

~~The kind that doesn't do anything to stop them from winning the game.~~  Aw geez, I guess they must find those really healthy and interactive ones to be a good support instead of the unhealthy and uninteractive ones.

Well, supports that cannot keep their carry alive on their own if a 7-0 assassin jumps on them would be nice for a starter. Something that doesnt invalidate whole classes from working would also be nice. Im thinking leona, thresh, bard, lux, karma, nami, taric.

Basically things that do not have an instant "you cannot die" button.

On the subject of mage supports doing too much damage, if supports didnt have the stupid gold income and extremely efficient items they have access to nowadays it wouldn't be a problem in the first place, or if they had to sacrifice vision/gold generation to get that damage or postpone the damage. And I still prefer them over the "my adc walked into their fountain but its all right" supports.

> [{quoted}](name=VICHEL CHAOS,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2018-04-09T22:07:54.089+0000)

Braum. He's fit af.
None of them really, but generally speaking, there are some that are ACTUALLY unhealthy for the game, like Janna.
{{champion:40}} looks healthy. She's really in shape, must have a good clean diet.
{{champion:43}}

> [{quoted}](name=Hexs Fortune,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=0017,timestamp=2018-04-10T00:15:35.669+0000)
>
> {{champion:43}}

I wouldn't argue Karma's healthy as a support, as her supportive capabilities tend to be "Is mantra up and its not laning phase? Mantra E." 

Outside of that, most of her support is something that other champs do better. 

Support Karma also tends to be overpowered or underpowered only based on her shield numbers.

So as a support main, here’s my two cents. Almost every support is fine, with strong counterpicks.  Some have really anoying abilities like Janna’s Mega shield and Ult.  But pick Leona into her and watch the adc cry. Sorraka?  Zyra with a rushed Morelos.  Tahm Kench?  Why do you think Brand support is a thing?  There’s kind of s triangle of support meta.

Tanks<poke
Poke<sustain
Sustain<Tank

Tank supports like Taric, Leona, Alistar, and others have hard engagements that nothing can sustain through pre 6, and after that their Ult CD are usually lower.  Poke champions murder tanks as they have to walk into range of both the ADC and them to get any gold. However, they usually can’t poke hard enough that a sorraka or Nami can’t just heal it back up. 

Obviously this is only a vague guideline with lots of exceptions like Sorraka opting into the poke item vs tanks or whatever the crap Rakan is as some weird front line enchanter who wants to be a tank but isn’t.  But if you went in knowing nothing, this would help you figure out what to pick and if you should play conservatively or aggressively if you picked first.
Season 2 ADC nostalgia from that "triangle of support meta."
Hmmm knowing the boards is say it's any kind of support that doesn't do anything at all that helps an adc survive.
Or do any damage that could threaten a non-support, or ever interfere in "1v1s" that are going on within melee range of the support.

> [{quoted}](name=Partholonian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vO37Q6u8,comment-id=001e0000,timestamp=2018-04-10T21:47:07.720+0000)
>
> Or do any damage that could threaten a non-support, or ever interfere in "1v1s" that are going on within melee range of the support.

God forbid it is doing what it does. Supporting.
Most just want a "healthy" one being one that's feeding their team. Also is {{champion:78}} support okay or no?

Supports won't be able to be healthy until they're decoupled from adcs.

People love to blame tanks for the weakness of bruisers, but the real problem is that supports exist to make adcs immune to divers and assassins. Currently, if a well-played support cannot do this, they're useless, so bruisers literally cannot function the way they're intended to late-game.

>but the real problem is that supports exist to make adcs immune to divers and assassins.

The problem is: ADCs are literally incapable of surviving otherwise.

There is *zero* counterplay to a Xin Zhao or a Zed as most ADCs, with the exception of being 5+ levels up on them (Which basically never happens: Assassins are in a solo lane and usually have the most early kills of the game, while ADCs are in a duo lane and rarely get solo kills). Xin dashes to you, knocks you up, does his weird-ass twirly stab thing, and autos one or two more times, and you're dead. There is no way to stop that from happening as just about any ADC. Vayne can if she has a wall to stun you into, but Vayne sucks with the shiv nerfs. Tristana can, with her entire kit, but she spends an ult to escape him, and he hasn't even used his smite yet.

None. Supports by there very design are meant to enable allies and disable enemies. That's the entire point and appeal of a support. you interact with the game indirectly through other players.

The only people who don't bitch about supports are support players, because everyone else just sees them as a cockblock. _Even tho that's the supports job. _

It's like asking what is healthy for an assassin to the boards. No one finds them healthy because their job is to pick ppl off and no one likes being picked off.

The only state in which people won't complain about them is if we make them wardbots again.

Quite frankly, the fact that people are actually bitching about supports is a good thing. It shows that supports have finally reached a point where they are actual champions, because previously they were essentially half champions. 
Every champ in the game gets complained about otherwise. Every single one.

People bitching about supports to a certain degree is actually healthy in this regard.
